channel.title: Onioncat and the future
channel.description:
Onioncat is still actively developed. The shift to HSv3 has implications that break automatic and secure routing since addresses have 260 bit routing while IPv6 has only 128 the full space can never be used since it would take over the space reserved for the public internet. HSv2 works all right for this right now, but when Tor deprecates it there won't be any seamless replacements left.
https://www.onioncat.org/2019/08/onioncat-security-considerations/#comments
Bernhard proposes a HSv2-3 compatibility system to allow for HSv3 lookups:
https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2019-September/045302.html

item.title: Onioncat and the future
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Onioncat is still actively developed. The shift to HSv3 has implications that break automatic and secure routing since addresses have 260 bit routing while IPv6 has only 128 the full space can never be used since it would take over the space reserved for the public internet. HSv2 works all right for this right now, but when Tor deprecates it there won’t be any seamless replacements left.

OnionCat – 28 Aug 19

Onioncat Security Considerations

Onioncat is an add-on for anonymization networks such as Tor and I2P. It adds real IP layer networking capability to hosts connected through Tor. Hence it is not enough to just refer to the security of Tor (or I2P). This article discusses security...

Bernhard proposes a HSv2-3 compatibility system to allow for HSv3 lookups:

https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2019-September/045302.html

Read full topic
